title: Why Wales will win the World Cup: Six reasons Warren Gatland's men can make history... and one stumbling block
text:
Wales have never reached a Rugby World Cup final. But the current Six Nations champions and Grand Slam winners have an opportunity to make history in Japan and give Warren Gatland the most fantastic send off after over a decade in charge.

First, though, they have to beat second-favourites for the tournament South Africa. That will not be an easy task. There are, however, plenty of reasons to be optimistic about Wales' chances.

In part three of our series of four, Ben Coles runs us through six reasons to for Wales fans to be cheerful... and the one stumbling block to their chances of glory.

Coach

This is it for Warren...
description: Wales have never reached a Rugby World Cup final.
